org.cove.jade.constraints
Class AngularConstraint

    java.lang.Object
    org.cove.jade.constraints.AngularConstraint
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constraint
public class AngularConstraint
extends java.lang.Object
implements Constraint

Class implementing an angular constraint. This attempts to constrain the angle between 3 particles to a particular value (by default, the angle they formed when the simulator started). 

    JADE - JAva Dynamics Engine

Field Detail

targetTheta

    public double targetTheta
Desired angle between the 3 particles. May be changed between calls to DynamicsEngine.timeStep() to move things around. This angle is from p1 to p3 around p2, positive clockwise (see constructor) and in radians.

Constructor Detail

AngularConstraint

    public AngularConstraint(Particle p1,
    Particle p2,
    Particle p3)
Instantiates an AngularConstraint. The angle to be maintained is that formed between the lines (p1,p2) and (p2,p3) (ie. the angle at vertex v2 in the triangle formed by p1, p2 and p3).

Method Detail

resolve

    public void resolve()
Used by the engine, don't worry about this.

Specified by:
resolve in interface Constraint

paint

    public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Specified by:
paint in interface Constraint

setStiffness

    public void setStiffness(double s)
Sets how strongly the angle is held, 1 = very strongly, 0 = not at all. Numbers above 1 can result in weird things happening.
